SCREEN2.text:
)ATTR
#  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(HIGH)
@  TYPE(text) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(LOW)
$  TYPE(OUTPUT) COLOR(BLUE) INTENS(LOW)
/  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(RED) INTENS(HIGH)
¢ TYPE(text) INTENS(HIGH) COLOR(WHITE)
)BODY expand(||)
%---MODE:&MODE |-|--/&SYSTEM  % SECURITY PANEL ---&ZUSER |-|------------
% &MSG
#OPTION  ===>_opt
#ACID    ===>_acid                                                             +
#DATA    ===>_data
#DATA2   ===>_data2
/ &MSG2
%    Function            Command (Option)    Parms (ACID, DATA, DATA2)
%
 @Change password  ¢PWREP             @ ACID = The TSS ID
 @(Internal Cust only)                  DATA = new password
 @
 @
 @Emp Num Search   ¢IE                @ ACID = The 4 or 5 char EMP #
 @
 @
 @Name Search      ¢NAME              @ ACID = 3 chars of last name
 @
 @
 @Unsuspend        ¢UNSUS             @ ACID = The TSS ID
 @
 @       All functions require the valid logonid in the ACID field
)INIT
  .HELP = spi00003
  &ZHTOP = spi00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
  &ZHindex = spi00003   /* TUTORIAL index        */
)PROC
)END

SECADD.text:
)ATTR
#  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(HIGH)
_  TYPE(INPUT) COLOR(white) INTENS(HIGH) caps(off)
/  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(turq) INTENS(HIGH)
)BODY
%---------------- &ACID ADD INFO PANEL  &theid ------------------------ --------
% &msg
#OPTION        ===>_OPTION
#Name last,first==>_name                 +#Dept ===>_ndept
#
#Specify a command stream from the defaults dataset ===>_MEM
#===>/&line1
#===>_line2
#===>_line3
#===>_line4
#===>_line5
#===>_line6
#===>_line7
#===>_line8
#===>_line9
#===>_line10
#===>_line11
#===>_line12
#===>_line13
#===>_line14
#===>_line15
#Enter%END#, %X# or %PF/3# to return to main menu
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
)PROC
  IF (&ZCMD = '.')
     &ZSEL = 'PGM(ISFISP) NOCHECK NEWAPPL(ISF)'
  &ZTRAIL = .TRAIL
)END

SECPROF.text:
)ATTR
#  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(HIGH)
/  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(RED) INTENS(HIGH)

)BODY
%---MODE:&mode   ------/&system   % SECURITY PANEL -----&ZUSER ------&ZTIME-----

%----------------------------------------------------------------------

%  _f2  _type2   _rsname2                                    + _access2

%  _f4  _type4   _rsname4                                    + _access4

%  _f6  _type6   _rsname6                                    + _access6

%  _f8  _type8   _rsname8                                    + _access8
%  _f9  _type9   _rsname9                                    + _access9
%  _f10 _type10  _rsname10                                   + _access10
%  _f11 _type11  _rsname11                                   + _access11
%  _f12 _type12  _rsname12                                   + _access12
%  _f13 _type13  _rsname13                                   + _access13
%  _f14 _type14  _rsname14                                   + _access14
%

  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
)PROC
  IF (&ZCMD = '.')

SECSHOW.text:
)ATTR
#  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(HIGH)
@ TYPE(INPUT) INTENS(HIGH) COLOR(WHITE) JUST(LEFT)
¬ TYPE(TEXT) INTENS(HIGH) COLOR(WHITE)

%---Message Display Service             +
#OPTION  ===>_opt
/ &POPMSG
#Type     ==>¬&type                 +
#Access   ==>¬&access                                     +
#Resource ==>¬&rsname                                     +
#Library  ==>¬&library                                    +
#Facility ==>¬&facility +    #Until   ==>¬&until          +
#Action   ==>¬&Action  +     #Program ==>¬&privpgm        +
#Other    ==>¬&Other                                      +

  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* fdIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS           */
)PROC
)END

SECSTAT.text:
)ATTR
#  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(HIGH)
/  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(Blue) INTENS(HIGH)
@  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(RED) INTENS(HIGH) HILITE(BLINK)
)BODY
%---MODE:&mode   ------/&system   % SECURITY PANEL -----&zuser -----&ZTIME-----
% &msg
/ &msg2
#OPTION  ===>_opt
#DS1     ===>_DS1                                 +#&dds1               +@_wds1
#DS2     ===>_DS2                                 +#&dds2               +@_wds2
#DS3     ===>_DS3                                 +#&dds3               +@_wds3
#DS4     ===>_DS4                                 +#&dds4               +@_wds4
#DS5     ===>_DS5                                 +#&dds5               +@_wds5
#DS6     ===>_DS6                                 +#&dds6               +@_wds6
#Defaults===>_DEF                                 +#&DDEF
#Panel   ===>_defpnl                              + (Default entry Panel  )
#Tver    ===>_TVER                                + (TSS VERSION routines )
#Backup  ===>_DSBACK                              + (backup DSN)
#Tables  ===>/&SCRTABLE        /&CMDTABLE         + (Command-screen tables)
#Srccmd  ===>/&SRCCMD                             + (Command table name   )
#Srcscr  ===>/&SRCSCR                             + (Screen table name    )
#Authnum ===>/&AUTHNUM                            + (1 to 10 auth level   )
#Version ===>/&TSSVERS                                                +
#CPUused ===>/&cpuused                                                +
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
)PROC
  IF (&ZCMD = '.')
     &ZSEL = 'PGM(ISFISP) NOCHECK NEWAPPL(ISF)'
  &ZTRAIL = .TRAIL
)END

&THECMD=&OPT
&THECMD2=&ZCMD
VPUT(THECMD,THECMD2) SHARED
)END

SPIBLNC.text:
)ATTR
#  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(HIGH)
/  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(RED) INTENS(HIGH)
@  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(RED) INTENS(HIGH) HILITE(BLINK)
)BODY
%---MODE:&mode   ------/&system   % SECURITY PANEL -----&ZUSER ------&ZTIME-----
% &msg
#Option  ===>_opt                                                              +
#ACID    ===>_acid                                                             +

%                C(Copy)
%#Funct  Type    Resource                               Access
%----------------------------------------------------------------------
% _f1  _A1      _type1  _rsname1                          + _access1
% _f2  _A2      _type2  _rsname2                          + _access2
% _f3  _A3      _type3  _rsname3                          + _access3
% _f4  _A4      _type4  _rsname4                          + _access4
% _f5  _A5      _type5  _rsname5                          + _access5
% _f6  _A6      _type6  _rsname6                          + _access6
% _f7  _A7      _type7  _rsname7                          + _access7
% _f8  _A8      _type8  _rsname8                          + _access8
% _f9  _A9      _type9  _rsname9                          + _access9
% _f10 _A10     _type10 _rsname10                         + _access10
% _f11 _A11     _type11 _rsname11                         + _access11
% _f12 _A12     _type12 _rsname12                         + _access12
% _f13 _A13     _type13 _rsname13                         + _access13
% _f14 _A14     _type14 _rsname14                         + _access14
%
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
)PROC
  IF (&ZCMD = '.')
     &ZSEL = 'PGM(ISFISP) NOCHECK NEWAPPL(ISF)'
  &ZTRAIL = .TRAIL
)END

SPIHELP.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   ` TYPE(SAC)
   \ AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%SPIDMIN  -------------------- TABLE OF CONTENTS ---------------------- TUTORIAL
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
\S1                                                                            \
)AREA S1
%                ----------------------------------------------
                 | SPI Expert mode tutorial version 8.0       |
                 ----------------------------------------------
+  The following topics are presented in sequence, or may be selected by
   entering a selection code in the option field:
      `0+ Settings        - Change some basic settings
      `1+ Basics          - Basic command functions
      `2+ Listing         - Listing ACIDs from the database
      `3+ Addition        - Adding IDs to the database
      `4+ Authorities     - Granting authority clusters
      `5+ Backup          - Backing up and retrieving ID images
      `6+ Conversion      - Converting IDs and resources
      `7+ Deletion        - Deleting IDs from the database
      `8+ Utility DSN     - Accessing the utility datasets
      `9+ Profiles        - Profile manipulation
     `10+ Group commands  - Issuing commands for multiple IDs
     `11+ Internal Options- TS-Admin internal commands
)INIT
  &ZHTOP = SPI00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
  &ZHINDEX= SPI00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
)PROC
   &ZSEL = TRANS(&ZCMD
                0,SPI00000
                1,SPI01000
                2,SPI02000
                3,SPI03000
                4,SPI04000
                5,SPI05000
                6,SPI06000
                7,SPI07000
                8,SPI08000
                9,SPI09000
               10,SPI10000
               11,SPI11000
               20,*SPI20000
               21,*SPI21000
                )
)END
/*                                                                */

SPIPOP.text:
)ATTR
#  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(HIGH)
/  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(Blue) INTENS(HIGH)
_  TYPE(INPUT) COLOR(blue) INTENS(HIGH) caps(off)
@  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(RED) INTENS(HIGH) HILITE(BLINK)
)BODY WIndow(70,17) OUTLINE(BOX) expand($$)
%--------&title -------$-$-------------&shortm
_Zcmd
% &MSG
% &sname
%
/&TITLE1
#&VNAME1        +--->_v1
/&TITLE2
#&VNAME2        +--->_v2
/&TITLE3
#&VNAME3        +--->_v3
/&TITLE4
#&VNAME4        +--->_v4
/&TITLE5
#&VNAME5        +--->_v5
/&TITLE6
#&VNAME6        +--->_v6
)END

SPISTAT.text:
)ATTR
#  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(HIGH)
$  TYPE(text) COLOR(white) INTENS(LOW)
/  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(Blue) INTENS(HIGH)
@  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(RED) INTENS(HIGH) HILITE(BLINK)
)BODY expand(||)
#SPI -----$MODE:$&MODE #------- SPI Basic Settings menu -|-|--------
% &msg
#SPI OPTION  ===>_OPT
% &tmsg
/ &msg2
#DS1     ===>_DS1                                 +#&dds1               +@&wds1
#DS2     ===>_DS2                                 +#&dds2               +@&wds2
#DS3     ===>_DS3                                 +#&dds3               +@&wds3
#DS4     ===>_DS4                                 +#&dds4               +@&wds4
#DS5     ===>_DS5                                 +#&dds5               +@&wds5
#DS6     ===>_DS6                                 +#&dds6               +@&wds6
#Defaults===>_DEF                                 +#&DDEF
#Tver    ===>_TVER                                + (TSS VERSION routines )
#Backup  ===>_DSBACK                              + (backup DSN)
#Environ ===>/&prefenv                            + (Default environment  )
#Tables  ===>/&SCRTABLE        /&CMDTABLE         + (Command-screen tables)
#Scrload ===>/&SCRLOAD                            + (Is screen table loaded?)
#Srccmd  ===>/&SRCCMD                             + (Command table name   )
#Usercmd ===>/&USERCMD                            + (User cmd table name  )
#Srcscr  ===>/&SRCSCR                             + (Screen table name    )
#Authnum ===>/&AUTHNUM                            + (1 to 10 auth level   )
#Version ===>/&TSSVERS                                                +
#CPUused ===>/&cpuused                                                +
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
)PROC
  IF (&ZCMD = '.')
     &ZSEL = 'PGM(ISFISP) NOCHECK NEWAPPL(ISF)'
  &ZTRAIL = .TRAIL
  vput (def,tver,dsback,ds1,ds2,ds3,ds4,ds5,ds6) profile
)END

SPIUTIL.text:
)ATTR
#  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(HIGH)
@  TYPE(OUTPUT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(LOW)
$  TYPE(OUTPUT) COLOR(BLUE) INTENS(LOW)
_  TYPE(INPUT) COLOR(red) INTENS(HIGH) caps(off)
/  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(RED) INTENS(HIGH)
¢ TYPE(OUTPUT) INTENS(HIGH) COLOR(WHITE)
)BODY expand(||)
%---MODE:&MODE |-|--/&SYSTEM  % SECURITY PANEL ---&ZUSER |-|------------
% &MSG
#OPTION  ===>_opt
#ACID    ===>_acid                                                             +
#DATA    ===>_data
#DATA2   ===>_data2
/ &MSG2
%    Function            Command (Option)    Parms (ACID, DATA, DATA2)
%
)MODEL   ROWS(ALL)
$FNAME                    ¢CMDLINE             @VARS                           +
)INIT
  .HELP = SPIhelp
  &ZHTOP = SPIhelp    /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
  &ZPRIM = YES
  &ZHINDEX= SPIhelp    /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
)PROC
&THECMD=&OPT
&THECMD2=&ZCMD
VPUT(THECMD,THECMD2) SHARED
)END

SPI00003.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   ` TYPE(SAC)
   \ AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TSADMIN  -------------------- TABLE OF CONTENTS ---------------------- TUTORIAL
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
\S1                                                                            \
)AREA S1
%                ----------------------------------------------
                 | SPI Expert mode tutorial version 1.5       |
                 ----------------------------------------------
+  The following topics are presented in sequence, or may be selected by
   entering a selection code in the option field:
      `1+ Basics          - Basic command functions
      `2+ Listing         - Listing ACIDs from the database
      `3+ Addition        - Adding IDs to the database
      `4+ Authorities     - Granting authority clusters
      `5+ Backup          - Backing up and retrieving ID images
      `6+ Conversion      - Converting IDs and resources
      `7+ Deletion        - Deleting IDs from the database
      `8+ Utility DSN     - Accessing the utility datasets
      `9+ Profiles        - Profile manipulation
     `10+ Group commands  - Issuing commands for multiple IDs
     `11+ Internal Options- TS-Admin internal commands
)INIT
  &ZHTOP = SPI00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
  &ZHINDEX= SPI00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
)PROC
   &ZSEL = TRANS(&ZCMD
                1,SPI01000
                2,SPI02000
                3,SPI03000
                4,SPI04000
                5,SPI05000
                6,SPI06000
                7,SPI07000
                8,SPI08000
                9,SPI09000
               10,SPI10000
               11,SPI11000
               20,*SPI20000
               21,*SPI21000
                )
)END
/*                                                                */

SPI01000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL -------------------SPI The Basics   --------------------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  The Basic Commands                                                          +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   These are the basic functions on this panel
   · Asuspend
     This command adds the TSS asuspend attribute to a specified ACID.

   · Us - Unsuspend
     This command removes the asuspend and suspend attributes from an
     ACID.

   · Expire
     This command adds an expiration date to the ACID.

   · Ue - Unexpire
     This command removes the asuspend and suspend attributes from an
     ACID.

   · Extend
     This extends the validity of the ACIDs current password.

   · Reset
     This resets the current password, removes Asuspend and suspend.

   · Pwreset
     This resets the current password.

)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI02000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL -------------------TS-Admin Listing ACIDs --------------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  Listing Acids from the database                                             +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   Listing Acids can be done with one of three delivered commands.
   Each one of these causes a command to be issued to TSS in the
   following format:
        TSS LIST( acid ) DATA( data)
                   |            |
                   |           The panel DATA field
                  The panel ACID field

   The commands are :
   · L       This issues the command directly to the security
      database and the output is displayed on your screen with no
      interference from the panel system. An example is below

      OPTION  ===> L
      ACID    ===> JOHNDOE
      DATA    ===> basic
      DATA2   ===>

      Note that the valid data fields are determined by your current
      security package version, NOT TS-Admin.


   · LS      This issues the command directly to the security
      database and the output is displayed in a scrollable screen
      format.


   · LO      This issues the command directly to the security
      database and the output is routed to a utility dataset, this
      does overlay any current data in the target dataset.

)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI03000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL -------------------TS-Admin Adding ACIDs ---------------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  Adding ACIDs to the TSS database                                            +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   Adding ACIDs is done with the ADD command. A sample is below.

      OPTION  ===> Add
      ACID    ===> testid
      DATA    ===>
      DATA2   ===>

   This command causes a data input screen to be displayed
   a section of which is seen below after the fields have been
   filled in. The name must be a valid TSS name ( no single quotes)
   The department must be a currently existing TSS department, and
   the user attribute field, if filled in, must be a valid existing
   authority stream member in the defaults dataset. After specifying
   these values and hitting enter the panel will appear something
   like this:


   OPTION ===>
   Name   ===> New employee           Dept ===> HRDEPT

   Standard user attributes will appear below. for ===> finance
   ===> TSS PER( TESTID ) DSN(TSS.JOBCLASS.Y) ACCESS(ALL)
   ===> TSS PER( TESTID ) TSOACCT(98000)
   ===> TSS PER( TESTID ) TSOPROC(STEPLIB)
   ===> TSS PER( TESTID ) TSOPROC(SPFLOGON)
   ===> TSS add( TESTID ) home('/u/users/$$')


   Any of the authority stream commands can be changed at this point.
   Note that in batch mode the creation stream will be appended to
   your current batch job stream and in online mode the ID will be
   created while you wait.

   Note that the ID will be created with the password specified in
   the NEWPASS variable set in the T$$.... exec.


)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI04000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL -------------------TS-Admin Granting Authority Streams--------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  Granting ACIDs clusters of authorities from an authority stream             +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   Granting authority streams is done with the AUTHRUN command:

      OPTION  ===> Authrun
      ACID    ===> testid
      DATA    ===> security
      DATA2   ===>

    This command inserts the ID specified into the authority
    stream of the defaults dataset member specified, and executes
    the stream. This function exactly emulates the process that
    is done at ID addition time except function ignores line one
    of the authority stream which is used only for ID creation.

    If the variable DEFAULTS in the T$$.... exec is set to
    TSADMIN.DEFAULTS , and member SECURITY in that dataset contained
    the following:

    DEPT( $DEPT$ ) TYPE(USER)
    TSS PER( $$ ) DSN(SAMPLE.DSN) ACCESS(ALL)
    TSS PER( $$ ) TSOACCT(98000)
    TSS PER( $$ ) TSOPROC(STEPLIB)
    TSS PER( $$ ) TSOPROC(SPFLOGON)
    TSS ADD( $$ ) PROF(SECUR1)
    TSS ADD( $$ ) PROF(CONSPROF)
    TSS ADD( $$ ) PROF(PROFILE3)

    The following stream would be executed:

    TSS PER( TESTID ) DSN(SAMPLE.DSN) ACCESS(ALL)
    TSS PER( TESTID ) TSOACCT(98000)
    TSS PER( TESTID ) TSOPROC(STEPLIB)
    TSS PER( TESTID ) TSOPROC(SPFLOGON)
    TSS ADD( TESTID ) PROF(SECUR1)
    TSS ADD( TESTID ) PROF(CONSPROF)
    TSS ADD( TESTID ) PROF(PROFILE3)

    In batch mode these commands would be deferred and queued to
    your batch JCL for later submission.




)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI05000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL -------------------TS-Admin Using the backup DSN--------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  The backup DSN and its use,                                                 +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   The TS-Admin system uses the backup dataset to hold text
   output from a standard TSS LIST command. The list is generated by
   default when an ID is deleted using the TS-Admin delete command
   but an administrator can manually take a backup by issuing the
   BACKUP command.

   Once backed up, the text can be retrieved with the GETBACKUP
   command and used as input to the CONVERT command to recreate the
   ID if needed.



)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI06000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY expand(||)
%TUTORIAL -----|-|-----------The Conversion function---|-|--------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  Converting an ACID or resource to its JCL equivalent                        +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   There are two main commands the perform conversion, CONVERT and
   CONVERTRESOURCE, each is explained below.

   CONVERT -
   This command creates a batch JCL stream that would, if submitted
   recreate the ACID in the ACID field. The stream is created in work
   dataset 2.

   Note: This output job must be manually submitted it is not
   subject to the panel "SUB" command. It is assumed that the
   administrator will change the stream. This command will also
   accept the parameter "BYPASS" in the ACID field, in which case
   it will convert the output in the dataset pointed to by by
   variable DS1 ( which should be a list of one or many TSS ACIDs
   ) into a command stream to duplicate the ACIDs.  This command
   DOES support multiple IDs!

   For example:
   If this were done:

   OPTION  ===> CMDO
   ACID    ===> tss list(acids) data(all,EXPIRE,pw) dept(mydept)
   DATA    ===>
   DATA2   ===>

   Then this command were issued:

   OPTION  ===> CONVERT
   ACID    ===> bypass
   DATA    ===>
   DATA2   ===>

   A stream would be created to duplicate the entire department which
   was listed. This command is very handy for moving
   groups from one system to another, or getting command syntax for a
   complicated permit or add command.

   Note: Passwords included in the output stream during a
   "BYPASS" are converted, even though passwords are are NOT
   converted during default convert processing.  To include
   passwords in the output stream a LO or CMDO command would
   normally be used. The EXPIRE data option should ALWAYS be specified
   when generating ouput for the convert command, because without
   it key data will be unavailable to the CONVERT command.


   CONVERTRESOURCE -
   This command creates a batch JCL stream that would, if submitted
   recreate the resource specified in the DATA field. The resource
   type must be specified in the ACID field. An example follows:

   OPTION  ===> CONVERTRESOURCE
   ACID    ===> dsn
   DATA    ===> sys1.linklib
   DATA2   ===>

   This would generate JCL followed by data that looks something
   like this in DS2:

   TSS PER(MVSTECH) DSN(SYS1.) +
        ACCESS(ALL)   ACTION(FAIL)
   TSS PER(STCSUB) DSN(SYS1.) +
        ACCESS(ALL)   ACTION(FAIL)
   TSS PER(DASDMGR) DSN(SYS1.) +
        ACCESS(ALL)   ACTION(FAIL)
   TSS PER(PERFMGR) DSN(SYS1.) +
        ACCESS(ALL)   ACTION(FAIL)



)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI07000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY expand(||)
%TUTORIAL -----|-|-----------Deleting an ACID----------|-|--------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  ACID deletion                                                               +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   Deletion of an ACID is a very simple process consisting of one
   command specifying the ACID to be deleted.

   OPTION  ===> DELETE
   ACID    ===> testid
   DATA    ===>
   DATA2   ===>


   A TSS list of the ACID will be taken to the PDS specified in
   the DSBACK variable to the member named for the ACID.
   Example:

   DSBACK =  The.backup.dsn
   ACID   = testid

   The dataset used for backup would be  'THE.BACKUP.DSN(TESTID)'

)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI08000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY expand(||)
%TUTORIAL -----|-|-----------The Utility Datasets------|-|--------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  Accessing the utility datasets and their format                             +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   TS-Admin uses five main utility datasets which are referred to
   in variables DS1 -DS5 .  The suffix numbers ( 1- 5) are used
   in the edit and browse commands to access the datasets.

   To Browse the datasets the letter B is combined with the
   dataset number you wish to browse, so the B1 command would open a
   browse session with the dataset specified in variable DS1. B2
   would browse dataset number 2 and so on.

   The Edit commands function exactly the same as the browse
   commands E1 is used to edit DS1, E2 to edit DS2 etc.

   The utility datasets themselves are used for a variety of
   purposes as documented below.

   DS1 - Lrecl 80
   This dataset is used for dynamic output, GETBACKUP, LO and CMDO
   use this dataset for output while CONVERT when specified with
   the bypass option uses this dataset for input. Data here will
   be overlayed frequently.

   DS2 - Lrecl 80
   This dataset is used for output JCL that is generated
   independantly of batch mode by the convert command.

   DS3 - Lrecl 80
   This dataset is used for output from the WRITEDEBUG command and
   the MODIFY command.

   DS4 - Lrecl 133
   This dataset is used for any wide data the is generated by the
   system.

   DS5 - Lrecl 80
   This dataset is used for batch JCL generation when in batch mode.


)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI09010.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY expand(||)
%TUTORIAL -----|-|---------The Global Replace Command-|-|-------------- TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  Replacing a profile database wide                                           +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   The REPPROF command will generate JCL that will replace a profile
   on a global basis, for example if the following were issued:

   OPTION  ===> REPPROF
   ACID    ===> OLDPROF
   DATA    ===> NEWPROF
   DATA2   ===>

   A stream would be generated to remove the profile OLDPROF from
   every ID that currently has it and replace it with the profile
   NEWPROF.

   A section of the generated stream is below:


  TSS ADD(YOURID) PROFILE(NEWPROF) AFTER(OLDPROF)
  TSS REM(YOURID) PROFILE(OLDPROF)
  TSS ADD(MYID) PROFILE(NEWPROF) AFTER(OLDPROF)
  TSS REM(MYID) PROFILE(OLDPROF)

)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI09020.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY expand(||)
%TUTORIAL -----|-|-----------Modifying Profiles--------|-|--------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  Modifying a profile in full screen mode                                     +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   This command creates a batch JCL stream that would, if submitted
   change the profile as you specified during the input process.

   Note: This output job must be manually submitted it is not
   subject to the panel "SUB" command. It is assumed that the
   administrator may change the stream.

   For example:
   If this were done:

   OPTION  ===> MODIFY
   ACID    ===> myprof
   DATA    ===>
   DATA2   ===>

   Then this screen would be presented:

   Option  ===>
   ACID    ===> MVSTECH

     Functions are A(Add) M(Modify) D(Delete) S(show details)
    Funct  Type    Resource                               Access
   ---------------------------------------------------------------------
           FACILITY CICSDIV
           FACILITY NCCF
           FACILITY VTP
           FACILITY NDM
           FACILITY OMON
           FACILITY TCPIP
           FACILITY VPS
           FACILITY BETA92


   The lower screen area is scrollable and the option column on
   the left hand side of that area allows you to specify one of
   four commands A (for add) , D ( for delete), M( for modify),
   and S ( for show details).

   For example if the A command was specified for a dataset
   rule of ICFCAT.MVS the following popup would be displayed.
   The specifications made here would be reflected in the JCL
   stream created at the conclusion of this command. Not that
   the A command does nothing to the rule selected it merely
   uses it as a model for a new rule to be added to the profile.

    ---Message Display Service
    OPTION  ===>

    Type     ==> DSN
    Access   ==> ALL
    Resource ==> ICFCAT.MVS
    Library  ==>
    Facility ==>                Until   ==>
    Action   ==> FAIL
    Program  ==>
    Other    ==>


    The M command would cause the exact same popup window to be
    displayed but an additional command would be placed in the
    JCL stream generated. That command is a revoke of the
    selected rule.  So any changes made will replace the selected
    rule.

    The D command causes a revoke to be placed into the JCL
    stream generated, removing the rule from the profile.

    The S command shows the details of a rule but allows no
    updates to be made to that permission.









)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI09030.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY expand(||)
%TUTORIAL -----|-|-----------Inserting profiles--------|-|--------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  Inserting profile(s) into a single ACID                                     +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   This command inserts the profiles specified in the DATA field into
   the ACID specified at the location in the DATA2 field.

   Note: IF the location is 0 then the profiles will be removed and
   not reinserted.

   For example:
   If this were done:

   OPTION  ===> IN
   ACID    ===> MYID
   DATA    ===> myprof
   DATA2   ===> 3

   Then MYPROF would be added to the ACID MYID in position 3 in
   the profile list. If the ID already has the profile it will be
   removed from MYID then inserted into position 3.


)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI10000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY expand(||)
%TUTORIAL -----|-|-----------Issuing Group Commmands---|-|--------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  TS-Admin                                                                    +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   Commands can be issued for a group of ACIDs connected to a
   common ACID. This is done by specifying the department,
   division, or profile in the ACID field and the desired command
   to be generated for each ID connected to that ACID in the DATA
   field.  The comand specified must contain the string ' $$ '
   without the quotation marks. This string will be replaced by
   each target ACID generated.  Example:

   OPTION  ===> GROUPCOMMAND
   ACID    ===> MYPROF
   DATA    ===> tss rem( $$ ) suspend
   DATA2   ===>


   The above command would generate a command stream to remove the
   suspend attribute for each ACID connected to the profile MYPROF.

)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI11000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   ` TYPE(SAC)
   \ AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TSADMIN  -------------------- Internal TS-Admin commands-------------- TUTORIAL
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
\S1                                                                            \
)AREA S1
+  The following topics are presented in sequence, or may be selected by
   entering a selection code in the option field:
      `1+ Batch           - Invoking batch mode
      `2+ Online          - Invoking online mode
      `3+ Sub             - Submitting batch JCL
      `4+ Status          - Viewing selected variables
      `5+ Commandload     - Loading a test command table
      `6+ Screenload      - Loading a test screen table
      `7+ Writedebug      - Creating and viewing the debug log
   These advanced topics will be presented only if selected:
     `20+ Customization   - Changing your TS-Admin environment
     `21+ Delivered Execs - Interfacing with the TS-Admin system
)PROC
   &ZSEL = TRANS(&ZCMD
                1,SPI11010
                2,SPI11020
                3,SPI11030
                4,SPI11040
                5,SPI11050
                6,SPI11060
                7,SPI11070
               20,*SPI20000
               21,*SPI21000
                )
)END

SPI11010.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL -------------------TS-Admin Batch command---------------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  TS-Admin                                                                    +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   The BATCH command changes your current processing mode to batch.
   In batch mode commands that update the database are deferred and
   their JCL equivalents are written to the JCL stream in DS5.
   How a command is treated in batch mode is determined by its
   definition in the command definition member which is pointed to
   by SRCCMD variable in your TSSINI or T$$... exec.

   Batch mode can be changed to online mode by issuing the ONLINE
   command or by issuing the SUB command. Be aware that the SUB
   command submits the JCL in DS5 immediately then switches the
   mode to online.
)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI20000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   ` TYPE(SAC)
   \ AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TSADMIN  -------------------- Customization of TS-Admin -------------- TUTORIAL
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
\S1                                                                            \
)AREA S1
+  The following topics are presented in sequence, or may be selected by
   entering a selection code in the option field:
      `1+ Screen          - Updating screen definitions
      `2+ Command         - Updating command definitions
      `3+ REXX source     - Updating TSSINI and T$$.... execs



)PROC
   &ZSEL = TRANS(&ZCMD
                1,SPI20010
                2,SPI20020
                3,SPI20030
                )
)END

SPI20010.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL -------------------Updating the Screen definition-------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  TS-Admin                                                                    +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
   The screen appearance can be customized to include commands
   that you add to the panel system. Unlike the CORECMD member,
   the screen definition member is column dependent!  There are
   three visible columns on the main panel that are defined in
   the first three fields, starting in columns 1, 23 and 41, and
   an authority indicator in columns 79-80.  The first three
   columns are shown to the user exactly as they appear in the
   screen definition member only if the authorization level of
   the user is equal to or above the authorization level for that
   line in the screen definition. This allows you to customize
   the member so that each level of authority only sees the
   commands that they are authorized to execute.  Be aware that
   the security authority of the command in the command
   definition member and the authority level defined in the
   screen definition member must match, or the user will either
   see options they cannot use or will not see options they are
   authorized to use.

)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI20020.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR default(%+@)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
   % TYPE(ET)
   @ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL -------------------Updating the Command definition------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>@ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  TS-Admin                                                                    +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1
  Commands are defined in member CORECMD in the delivered parmlib,
  and referenced by the variable SRCCMD.  The value of SRCCMD is
  set in the TSSINI Exec.  The command definition member is read
  each time that a user invokes the panel system.  The delivered
  command member will function without any modifications.  Optional
  changes can be made if you need to add commands or change the
  default security requirements of delivered commands.  Note: It is
  always a good idea to make a backup copy of this member prior to
  making changes.  Below is a section of the PARMLIB member
  CORECMD, which defines the CONVERT command to the panel system.
  The first line is merely a comment, while the second line
  actually defines the CONVERT command to the panel system.  This
  member is read in word by word--that is, it is not column
  independent.

  Word 1: Panel Command Parameter (PNLCMD)
  Word 1 on each line is the panel command parameter
  (indicated by the PNLCMD header in the comment).  This must
  be an exact match with the command entered by the user on
  the panel.  For example, the line below will receive control
  when CONVERT is entered on the panel system command line.

  * PNLCMD CMDNAME    MSG    DATA DATA2 AUTH TRAP BATCH  VARS
   CONVERT   TVER.CON  1     0      0    5   ON    2     ACID

  Word 2: Internal Command Parameter (CMDNAME)
  Word 2 on each line is the internal command parameter
  (indicated by the CMDNAME header in the comment). This is
  the command that will be issued by the system itself
  internally to accomplish the work that the user requested.
  This must be a REXX exec, CLIST, or load module available to
  this TSO user.  A special keyword is allowed for this parameter
  only, it is the TVER prefix.  This will be replaced with the
  three-character code, which indicates the security package and
  version level.  For example if you are using TSS version 5.0
  the prefix will be T50, so the actual REXX exec name that will
  invoked here is T50CON.  The TVER variable is set in the
  TSSVERS REXX EXEC. No other variable will be interpreted in
  CMDNAME parameter!

  * PNLCMD CMDNAME    MSG    DATA DATA2 AUTH TRAP BATCH  VARS
   CONVERT   TVER.CON  1      0     0    5    ON   2     ACID

  Word 3: Message Parameter (MSG)
  Word 3 on each line is the message parameter (indicated by
  the MSG header in the comment). This determines whether at
  the conclusion of this command the panel system should
  retrieve the variable SECRC (via an ISPEXEC VGET  PROFILE
  service) and display it on the command line as the result of
  the command.  The valid values here a re 0 or 1.  If a zero
  is specified the return code is dis played at the conclusion
  of the command.  A 1 causes the returned message to be
  displayed.

  * PNLCMD CMDNAME    MSG    DATA DATA2 AUTH TRAP BATCH  VARS
   CONVERT   TVER.CON  1      0     0    5    ON   2     ACID

  Word 4: Data Parameter (DATA)
  Word 4 on each line is the data parameter (indicated by the
  DATA header in the comment). This determines whether the
  data field on the panel must be filled in prior to
  invocation of this command, and, if so, what must be present
  in the field. The valid values here are 0, 1, NUM, CHAR,
  OPTC, or OPTN, as defined in the following table.

  Data Parameter Values for Panel Fields
  Value Definition
  0     Value is not required.
  1     Value must be filled in.
  NUM   Value must be numeric.
  CHAR  Value must be filled with a character value.
  OPTN  Optional value; if specified, must be numeric.
  OPTC  Optional value; if specified, it must be a character.

  * PNLCMD CMDNAME    MSG    DATA DATA2 AUTH TRAP BATCH  VARS
   CONVERT   TVER.CON  1      0     0    5    ON   2     ACID

  Word 5: Second Data Parameter (DATA2)
  Word 5 is exactly the same as word 4 except it refers to the
  DATA2 screen value.

  Word 6: Authority Parameter (AUTH)
  Word 6 on each line is the authority parameter (indicated by the
  AUTH header in the comment). The convert command specifies a 5 a
  s its authority level.

  * PNLCMD CMDNAME    MSG    DATA DATA2 AUTH TRAP BATCH  VARS
   CONVERT   TVER.CON  1      0     0    5    ON   2     ACID

  Word 7: Out-trap Parameter (TRAP)
  Word 7 on each line is the out-trap parameter (indicated by
  the TRAP header in the comment).  The possible values of
  this parameter are ON and OFF and LOG.  When ON is
  specified all output from this exec is suppressed via the
  REXX out-trap facility.  When off is specified any messages
  written are shown to the user immediately.  The LOG option
  in addition to trapping output of the function writes a
  one-line record to the TS-Admin log dataset (specified in
  the LOGDSN variable in TSSINI).  Most functions should
  specify ON or LOG and write debug only messages to the
  screen.  Suppressed messa ges can be viewed with the
  WRITEDEBUG function.

  * PNLCMD CMDNAME    MSG    DATA DATA2 AUTH TRAP BATCH  VARS
   CONVERT   TVER.CON  1      0     0    5    ON   2     ACID
  .
  Word 8: Batch Environment Setting (BATCH)
  Word 8 on each line is the batch environment setting (
  indicated by the BATCH header in the comment  ). The
  possible values for this parameter are 0, 1 or 2 .

  0  -  A value of 0 indicates that this command will not be
  issued in batch mode, but that a record will be written to
  the accrued JCL stream instead. This value is normally
  specified for a command that updates the security database
  directly.

  1  -  A value of 1 indicates that the command is to be
  issued in batch mode and supports a pre-opened batch file.
  This would normally be specified for a command that writes
  multiple updates to the batch file. This setting is used
  rarely and usually indicates a command that is doing a large
  amount of decision making.

  2  - A value of 2 indicates that the command is to be issued
  immediately without respect to the mode with no pre-opened
  batch file. Any command using this setting should be a
  short running command that performs no security updates.

  * PNLCMD CMDNAME    MSG    DATA DATA2 AUTH TRAP BATCH  VARS
   CONVERT   TVER.CON  1      0     0    5    ON   2     ACID

  Arguments Following Word 8
  Words following word 8 are a list of arguments to pass to
  the invoked routine on the command line. There are several
  control char acters that can be included to control how the
  argument string is created.  These control characters and
  their function are given below:
  _     An underscore indicates that any value that follows is
  a literal and should not be substituted.

  <    The less-than sign indicates that any preceding spaces
  should be deleted.

  Example 1: If  these variables are set:
  DSBACK = SYS1.BACKUP
  ACID   = MYID
  DS1    = 'TECH.MYID.C1'
  DATA   =  ABC
  DATA2  =  DEF
  then the variable string below:
  TRAP BATCH  VARS
  ON          2         DSBACK  <_( <ACID <_)   DS1   _SHR
  would be passed as this argument:
  SYS1.BACKUP(MYID)  'TECH.MYID.C1'  SHR

  Example 2: If  the same variables are set:
  DSBACK = SYS1.BACKUP
  ACID   = MYID
  DS1    = 'TECH.MYID.C1'
  DATA   =  ABC
  DATA2  =  DEF
  then the string below:
  __PER( <ACID __) __DSN(SYS1.STUF. <DATA <__. <DATA2 __) __ACCESS(ALL)
  would be passed as this argument:
  per(MYID  )  DSN(SYS1.STUF.ABC.DEF) ACCESS(ALL)

)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI21000.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   ` TYPE(SAC)
   \ AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TSADMIN  -------------------- Interfacing with TS-Admin--------------- TUTORIAL
%OPTION  ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
\S1                                                                            \
)AREA S1
+  The following execs are discussed in sequence, or may be selected by
   entering a selection code in the option field:
      `1+ Tssut           - The driver routine
      `2+ Authrun         - The authority stream exec
      `3+ Fsdisp          - The output trapper
      `4+ Giveuid         - The OMVS authority exec
      `5+ Highuid         - The UID query exec
      `6+ T..cmdo         - The output router
      `7+ T..gdat         - The get data routine
      `8+ T..icomp        - The dynamic convert routine
      `9+ Tssdpanl        - The variable display panel
)PROC
   &ZSEL = TRANS(&ZCMD
                1,SPI21010
                2,SPI21020
                3,SPI21030
                4,SPI21040
                5,SPI21050
                6,SPI21060
                7,SPI21070
                8,SPI21080
                9,SPI21090
                )
)END

SPI21010.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL -------------------The main driver routine--------------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  TSSUT                                                                       +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1

   Most communication with the main driver routine can be done with
   the standard TSSINI and T$$.... variables that exist currently.
   There are some cases where a user defined variable is required to
   be defined to TSSUT. This is done with the VARLIST variable
   in the T$$.... exec.  Each variable named in VARLIST will be
   retrieved via the ISPEXEC VGET service upon TSSUT start up.
   This will allow your variables to be specified in the command
   definition member and automatically passed to subsequent
   routines. A variable specified here however must exist in the
   profile pool, that is it must have been subject of a VPUT
   command.

)INIT
)PROC
)END

SPI21080.text:
)PANEL KEYLIST (ISRHELP ISR)
)ATTR
   % TYPE(ET)
   _ TYPE(NEF) PAD(USER) CAPS(ON)
   + TYPE(NT)
   # AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
)BODY
%TUTORIAL -------------------The dynamic convert exec-------------------TUTORIAL
%COMMAND ===>_ZCMD                                                             +
%
+  T50ICOMP                                                                    +
#S1                                                                            #
)AREA S1

   This command accepts two parameters the function and the list
   of ACIDs.  If BYPASS is specified for the ACIDs parameter then
   DS1 will be used as the input to this exec.  The results from
   this exec are written to DS2 or to the screen if DS2 is not
   available.  Here are the valid values for the function
   parameter:

   Translate:
     This function is used for debugging, when
     specified the exec writes out the translated
     interim data for each ID specified in the
     acidlist. This is excellent for seeing how an ID
     is being manipulated internally. Be aware this
     function writes output directly to the screen so
     you may wish to front end this option
     with some of of output trapping. Like the FSDISP
     exec for example.

    Compare:
      This function compares the permission of each ID
      in the acidlist to the first ID specified in the
      list.

    Rebuild:
      This function creates a stream to recreate an ID
      The stream contains the TSS create command in
      addition to the add and permit commands that are
      generated by the permit function below.

    Permit:
      Exactly the same output as above but with no TSS
      create command for each ID.
    Revoke:
      This creates a stream that would remove all
      permissions from the ID.

















































)INIT
)PROC
)END

TBVIEW.text:
)attr default(%+_)
  @ type(output) intens(high) color(red )  /* key values */
  \ type(output) intens(high) color(green)    /* name values */
  ~ type(output) intens(high) just(right) caps(off)
                                            /* screen x of n */
)body width(&zscreenw) expand(//)
+ISPF Table :\TBLNAME +/-/
%Command ==>_ZCMD    ~scrnum
+
&modhdrs
)model
&modvars
)init
 .zvars = '&mdzvars'
 &pt1 = 'Screen'
 &pt2 = 'of'
 &scrnum  = '&pt1 &curscrn &pt2 &maxscr'
 &ztdmark = '---------- Bottom of Table ----------'
)end

VARPANEL.text:
)ATTR
#  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(TURQ) INTENS(HIGH)
/  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(RED) INTENS(HIGH)
@  TYPE(TEXT) COLOR(RED) INTENS(HIGH) HILITE(BLINK)
)BODY
%---MODE:&mode   ------/&system   % SECURITY PANEL -----&zuser -----&ZTIME-----
% &msg
/ &msg2
#OPT      ===>_OPT                                                    +
#&VNAME1 +===>_vval1
#&VNAME2 +===>_vval2
#&VNAME3 +===>_vval3
#&VNAME4 +===>_vval4
#&VNAME5 +===>_vval5
#&VNAME6 +===>_vval6
#&VNAME7 +===>_vval7
#&VNAME8 +===>_vval8
#&VNAME9 +===>_vval9
#&VNAME10+===>_vval10
#&VNAME11+===>_vval11
#&VNAME12+===>_vval12
#&VNAME13+===>_vval13
#&VNAME14+===>_vval14
#&VNAME15+===>_vval15
#&VNAME16+===>_vval16
#&VNAME17+===>_vval17
#&VNAME18+===>_vval18
#&VNAME19+===>_vval19
#&VNAME20+===>_vval20
)INIT
  .HELP = ISR00003
  &ZHTOP = ISR00003   /* TUTORIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS        */
)PROC
  IF (&ZCMD = '.')
     &ZSEL = 'PGM(ISFISP) NOCHECK NEWAPPL(ISF)'
  &ZTRAIL = .TRAIL
)END
